0.title: Audiosphere
0.objective: Create a playlist visualizer for the 4 day hackathon at Fullstack Academy of Code
0.idea: The idea of Audiosphere emerged out of my love for the figurative space that music playlists create. I wanted to amplify this playlist experience by coupling its personal element with a literal space.
0.description: Audiosphere is a music streaming web application that uses Spotify Web API and Three-JS to create a 3d planetary system with your Spotify playlists.
0.preview: Imagine a planetarium for your playlists

1.title: StackQuest
1.objective: Create an in-browser and multiplayer game that can handle real-time interaction from multiple clients
1.idea: As folks who enjoy games and challenges, my team at Fullstack Academy Of Code decided to create an in-browser game. In-browser over native because we wanted to build an accessible product and bring a social element by leveraging socket IO for a multiplayer experience
1.description: StackQuest is an in-browser real-time multiplayer adventure game. The multiplayer aspect is powered by Socket IO and the game logic leverages Phaser JS.

2.title: Portfolio
2.objective: Develop an interactive portfolio website that animates according to the direction of a user's interaction without losing functionality
2.idea: I aimed to create a website that responds to the direction of user interaction. By using a circular navigation I thought it would look natural with rotation animations that demonstrates the direction in which the user drags.
2.description: Meta... This portfolio website was built using react-redux framework coupled with styled-components and gsap for page aesthetics. I tried to take a different approach with page navigation by taking into account the navigation direction
